meanings.definition: A type of onion with a small white bulb and long green stalks.
meanings.sent1: I chopped some scallions to add flavor to the soup.
meanings.sent2: The scallions added a fresh crunch to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The scallions danced in the pan as they sizzled with the garlic.
meanings.sent4: The scallions stood tall in the garden, like little green soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the scallions filled the kitchen, making my mouth water.

meanings.definition: The green stalks of the scallion plant, used as a vegetable in cooking.
meanings.sent1: Mom sautéed the scallions with soy sauce for a tasty stir-fry.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a handful of chopped scallions as garnish.
meanings.sent3: The scallions giggled as they huddled together in the stir-fry pan.
meanings.sent4: The scallions whispered secrets of flavor to the other vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green of the scallions brightened up the dish beautifully.
